Reviews.Title: “Well placed pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: luftmdlg
Reviews.Content: This Rather small hotel is situated neat Piazza Navona. 10 minutes walk from Rome's best shopping area and a minute's walk from an abundance of restaurant and bars. Rooms are well appointed. Service is personal and very good. We received tasty canapés every evening (our children stayed at a slightly cheaper room and did not receive). We enjoyed our stay and recommend the hotel, Though we suffered from noise from people visiting the bars. Our children's room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home...”
Reviews.Author: Erica W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raphael is MORE than location. I have stayed here numerous times. It is a home away from home... The Raphael is in the centre within walking distance to many important attractions. This hotel is refined and elegant with a warm feeling. It is beautifully appointed with an eclectic blend of fine artwork, antiques and furniture. The staff at the reception desk is helpful and kind. They speak several languages, ready to assist with museum tickets, calling for a taxi, tours, etc. The doormen are polite and helpful with luggage and taxis. The housekeeping staff is friendly and thorough as the rooms are very clean. The restaurant staff is attentive, friendly and professional. The chefs use only the very best products in their cooking and service. Breakfast is delicious and dinner is extraordinarily good. The rooftop terrace is simply beautiful. Your view of Rome, at this vantage point, is stunning. Dinner or cocktails on this terrace is quite special. Staying at the Hotel Raphael is a combination of many things...location, elegance, excellent staff, a wonderful restaurant and an incredible rooftop terrace. The Hotel Raphael is a special place you never want to leave...a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Roman Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: PhilliesFaninColo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raphael from 3/23-3/26. We were celebrating my wife's birthday and were welcomed at check-in with a free room upgrade. I think it was more coincidental than anything else, but we weren't complaining. Each day we were surprised with an unexpected treat from free water bottles to a fruit basket to appertivo on our last night. The Front Desk was very helpful and the staff as a whole was very, very friendly. One point to note: We stayed in the Richard Meier rooms on the 2nd floor, which are awesome! Very contemporary look and design with several high-end finishes. Lastly, the location was very central, which was great for first-timers in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A dream hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: We just checked into the Hotel Raphael in Rome and the place is like a dream. Elegant decor, gorgeous/spacious rooms and immaculate service. The location is just near Piazza Navona, so ideal for easy walking to all major sites. But the best part is the wonderful attention to detail - the staff are very attentive and the overall service is fantastic. The restaurant has also been a nice surprise - excellent food and a roof terrace that provides incredible views. We are thrilled that we booked here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience which could have been an excellent one...”
Reviews.Author: Olga K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed very beautiful in a fantastic location. Was chosen thanks to positive reviews and recommendation of one of my colleagues who stayed there before. Unfortunately, we obviously had a bad luck. Incompetence of some staff members was a real shock: reception was forgetting quite simple things they were asked for and unfortunately it was not only once. Although there were some employees who tried to be helpful. The housemaid which we once we had a misfortune to communicate with was a disaster, I cannot recall such a rude and offensive conduct in any hotel I was before. The room which was given to us first was extremely small, I would call it a single room rather than double. It's good that they at least changed it for slighthly bigger and more modern room after the first day. Overall this could have been a fantastic stay but unfortunately...The staff issue is really to be looked into.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: Marawella
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise, the hotel is very close to piazza navona which has a great ambience. We loved the hotel, very good breakfast. The staff was very helpful and restaurants recommendation were spot on. Rooms are well equipped but small. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - a romantic location in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Roger W
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here in December 2011, right before Christmas. Prior to travelling, I had deliberated over several other 5* hotels right the way across Rome, but Hotel Raphael seemed to top them all in terms of budget, locale and atmosphere. It's not the most expensive 5* hotel in Rome, but you get excellent value for money if you take a double room. It could not be in a better location - being on a side street right behind the Piazza Navona and a short(ish) walk away from any of Rome's top attractions. Granted, my fiancee couldn't really stroll too far in her high heels each night, but the Raphael really is bang in the middle of it all. Which also contributes to its atmosphere. The cobbled street it sits in, right off the piazza, and the ivy-clad exterior are a slice of magic. The interior of the hotel is ever so slightly gaudy (think bright red velvet sofas/cushions and gold rope surrounds!) but it is warm and welcoming. The staff are friendly, professional and attentive (including the high-pitched, squeaky doorman). Our room was very comfortable and our stay was thoroughly enjoyable. The ONLY downside was the occasional noise from revellers leaving Piazza Navona....but then again, this is Rome and you shouldn't be in bed before midnight!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, tasteful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: John1970031
Reviews.Content: The Raphael is just behind the Piazza Navona - not a place known for its solitude. The hotel, however, is in a quiet sidestreet, the cab ride from the central station takes around 10 minutes and costs ca. 12.- Euros. A friendly staff, a tasteful reception area and a wonderful terrace are amongst the first impressions. The rooms are decorated in a very modern, sleek wooden design, extremly clean and well maintained. Even the mattresses are first class (Tempur). Breakfast is in a rather small room, but given the ambiente and the age of the hotel it's also very stylish. No complaints about the presentation and service during breakfast at all. Restaurant recommendations of the staf should be trusted though one has to be very specific: if you want a good pasta it doesn't help your waistline if you are sent to a place which is reknown for its wonderful chocolate cakes. Checkout was swift, friendl and professional - the only downside - but this is hardly unique to the Raphael - is the enormous rip-off when you had a bottle of water or so from the mini-bar. Those prices are not only prohibitive, they are just insulting.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and service, very enjoyable hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TheRookieTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be a little expensive but it excelled in every criteria that I could think of. We stayed at this small but wonderful hotel from 25th January 2012 for 6 nights. We had the Richard Meier Suite with terrace (Room 418) was just amazing. It was very quiet, very modern, beautifully appointed and spacious. We loved the having the terrace that overlooks the neighbourhood. The welcome champagne upon arrival was a really nice touch. The location is terrific. Quiet street just behind the charming Piazza Navona. It was perfect to experience this amazing city for the first time. Close enough to walk to many famous sights including the Pantheon, the Vatican City, Spanish Steps,Trevi Fountain, Trastevere and many more. A few minutes walk you will get to Largo Argentina and Corso Vittorio Emanuele II where you are able to take trams and buses. All of the staffs including the ladies who cleaned our room daily were gracious and polite. The front desk in particular were always very helpful. Our room was cleaned at least twice a day, pastries and chocolate were left in our room every evening when we got back. Breakfast was great. Contrary to some of the reviews I have read here, the wifi was actually very reliable and fast. This hotel was pretty busy even during winter so it was not as quiet compared to the other hotels that I stayed in Italy. Nonetheless it was a wonderful and very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay at Hotel Raphael, Rome”
Reviews.Author: AliGCumbria
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raphael is absolutely gorgeous! It is very comfortable, clean and quiet. A reasonable journey from Campiano Airport should cost you no more than 40 euro. Our sheets were changed every day and the delicious chocolates on our bed every night were fantastic. The Bulgari toiletries smell gorgeous so enjoyed several long soaks in the bath. Breakfast is amazing, made extra special by starting the day with a refreshing 'Bucks Fizz' Everything about the hotel is perfect the staff are very courteous and are most helpful. Would highly recommend and would most definately visit again. - Mike and Alison

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable, clean and quiet hotel, designed attractively and on a human scale, and really well located in a quiet central street. The staff are courteous and not over-deferential. Our Richard Meier suite (free upgrade) had a very comfortable mattress and a sparkling bathroom but note that the water pressure made the bath fill very slowly. The breakfast is outstanding. Good limo service which cheated the taxi strike.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fine Service”
Reviews.Author: upperwestsider72
Reviews.Content: The convenient location is a big plus. The hotel is right behind the Piazza Navonna, and this came in very handy during a taxi strike, as many attractions (the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Ara Pacis, San Luigi dei Francesi) are within easy walking distance. Santa Maria della Pace, with its wonderful Raphael frescoes, is next door. There are a number of good restaurants (especially on Via delle Coppelle) within a block or two. I took note of the complaints about the "Classic" rooms and booked a Deluxe Room and a Deluxe Suite, which were spacious and very well appointed, with big bathrooms and lots of closet space. The front desk personnel were very courteous, knowledgeable and helpful. Service was prompt and cheerful. The rooftop terrace presents wonderful views of the Centro Storico, although the restaurant and bar there were closed (this being January). When the weather is warmer, I'm sure this is a wonderful place for drinks or dinner. The breakfast spread was quite extensive, suited to both European and American tastes. The blood orange juice (which looks like tomato juice), was great. Ate a good dinner at the restaurant, which (perhaps because of the taxi strike) was deserted except for us that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Living the luxe life in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fashionbizarre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Raphael. We stayed our last night at the end of a 3 week trip around Italy and it was the perfect place to speak that last night. The staff was excellent and the room (a Richard Meier) was so comfortable and chic. I fell in love with Bvlgari au the blanc bath products and have purchased the whole line to enjoy at home. The fragrance reminds me of an unforgettable trip, and evening. It's worth it just for the roof deck. We had hoped to have dinner there but due to early rain showers it was closed. Although closed we discovered that it was not locked and after dinner in the neighborhood, we enjoyed after dinner drinks on the roof with a 360 degree view of the city--breathtaking! The location is wonderful--just steps to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and so much more. The hotel arranged our car to the airport the following morning and all went smoothly. We didn't have time for breakfast (the story of our lives) but hope that the next time we stay at Hotel Raphael we will be able to enjoy dinner on their terrace. Even if we won't have it all to ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: razsh
Reviews.Content: We weekend 5 / 1 end of the holiday. Hotel decorated and beautiful, the staff courteous and doing everything you should make the stay and give a feeling of vacation. We have upgraded to a suite of Richard Meier, of course, was extraordinary. Breakfast is excellent and includes a hot meal, also fruit in abundance, even cakes and other goodies. the place of the excellent hotel close to almost all the important sites around the many restaurants. In sum real 5-star hotel, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Like a fairytale”
Reviews.Author: KassandraCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This is our favourite hotel in Rome. The decor is classic italian style, sligthly opulent in a stylish way - unless you prefer the very scandinavianly minimalist Meier-rooms. We don't. The staff is nicer than nice, we especially love Domenico. Lago Febo is a beautiful area to stay. This is so Rome. It's not cheap but it's a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting Raphael- perfect holiday for architecture buffs or romantics”
Reviews.Author: GrandestTour
Reviews.Content: A modern Richard Meier room in the lovely Raphael amidst ancient Rome was the perfect celebration for a special occasion. The Richard Meier suite was spacious, beautifully furnished, and made the perfect segue for a visit to Richard Meier's Ara Pacis, now with the extra bonus of a temporary Audrey Hepburn exhibit. (www.arapacis.it/mostre_ed_eventi/mostre/audrey_a_roma/galleria_di_opere/(img)/1). Great holiday for architecture, art, and film buffs. Stay in theme and dress smartly for this experience. Best surprise of all, the Raphael has a talented new chef, who presents delicious food beautifully. We chose a lovely wine from a small winery in Campania, perfect with the excellent steak and sauce, served up on the terrace surrounded by domes and bell towers. A sophisticated, gracious package you can put together yourself. Only some Raphael floors are designed by Meier; the other floors are lovely in an antique-furnished romantic way. Having seen Meier's work in Atlanta and Des Moines, had to stay in a Meier room. Soothing natural colors, clean lines, sliding bath tub door communicates with the bedroom area. Table has plenty of space for a Champagne bucket. Have at least one meal in this romantic hotel. Set in a tiny quiet piazza steps away from an evening stroll in Piazza Navona (Christmas market in December to January 6) and the Raphael frescoes in Santa Maria della Pace. Walk everywhere. Sound perfect? It was!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: annmarie155
Reviews.Content: The location just off Piazza Navona is very convenient with lots of good restaurants nearby. A comfortable walk to many of the important sights. Our room was quite small but comfortable. The hotel provided bottled water and daily treats. The terrace on the roof was wonderful; we spent every afternoon there enjoying a glass of wine. The restaurant was excellent. The breakfast buffet was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Property, Strange Mix of Styles”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: The Raphael is an ideally located property, with above average service, and curiously opposing styles of decor. The location, one block away from Piazza Navona is central, but the street itself is quiet and calm. The varying interior styles of the Raphael are interesting, though the differentiation verges on bipolar. The lobby, a mix of sleek modern furniture with ornate art and architecture is slightly odd, and channels the mix in the rest of our hotel. Upon checkin-in we were upgraded to a Richard Meier room, and despite the poor view, it was sleek and comfortable. The room itself, decorated in blonde wood with pale stucco was tiny, and the bathroom was cavernous, though they both felt brighter and more connected being divided by a window and louvered shutters. The service staff at the Raphael was helpful, though not exactly attentive, and were not quite as welcoming as other hotels at which we have stayed. The service, location, and room combined, the Raphael is a pleasant, well located hotel, and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Comfort in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HillaryR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raphael offered a superior standard of accommodation and service and we enjoyed a perfect stay. Our suite was spacious, including a TV seating area, desk and chair, and a small dressing room. The marble bathroom offered bath/shower, and a separate shower. Our view covered the terracotta roof and spire of a marvellous old church; it could only be Rome. Centrally located, adjacent to Piazza Navona, though tucked away in a quiet corner. The staff were extremely professional and courteous, and breakfast was excellent. If you read this, and love ice cream, look no further than Frigidari for the best gelato in Rome, and it is only around the corner from the Raphael!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PR R
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and it well deserves its 5 star rating. The staff were friendly yet professional and we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Over and above”
Reviews.Author: Directeur0
Reviews.Content: We describe the hotel as over and above because it is a unique place where the staff and ambience is truly 5 star combined with Italian character. We had the joy of staying in the special designer suite by Richard Meier. Besides impeccable design qualities/options, it has a cozy terrace with a lemon tree! We received treats everyday, too! The location is convenient to reaching other destinations. You can walk to the Vatican area, as well as the Pantheon, and there's a busline beyond the Piazza Novana where you can get buses to the Coloseo, etc. In this area, there's an information kiosk, so the person there will help you to know which buses to take. This hotel is expensive, but the world needs a few uncompromising spots! It is as good as any 5star+ in the Middle East, and it's a real historic experience. Neighborhood is charming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location; Great Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: jorourke99
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient to all the major attractions. Nice, spacious rooms that are clean. Rooftop bar provides great view (at a price!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Beautiful Rooms with lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: JennyH116
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away in a quiet street close to Piazza Navona and within walking distance to most tourist attractions .We were upgrade to a suite and the room was spacious with a good size bathroom with lots of amenities, the service is excellent, everyday we had a scrumptious afternoon tea of cakes left in our room for us, we received champagne and fruit on arrival not to mention chocolates every night. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and delicious. This is a true five star hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Raphael”
Reviews.Author: CCGetaway
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this extremely lovely hotel right in the heart of Rome, near the Piazza Navona. It looks charming and all tucked-away from the outside, but is highly upgraded and contemporary in the rooms themselves. The rooms aren't large (hey, it's Italy!) but very comfortable with large bathrooms (2 sinks, separate bath and shower). Breakfast was really wonderful, and for me, a small basket of gluten-free breads (warm!) that I didn't even have to ask for. A real pleasure. The staff is outstanding, and helped us book a wonderful guide (Denis) for a morning tour of the Forum and Coliseum. There is a taxi stand just half a block away, and a ton of great little trattorias just down the street. HIGHLY recommend Ponte & Parione, especially if you can't eat gluten or have celiac disease, but my husband had pizza/pasta that was wonderful as well. We went there twice! Definintely upscale, definintely pricey, definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in a top location!”
Reviews.Author: IgglePiggle_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 4 nights of our honeymoon. The hotel is in a wonderful location, close to Piazza Navona - this area is more expensive to stay in than other parts of Rome but we felt that it was worth the extra money to avoid having to take public transport everywhere (not fun in the heat) and to have somewhere safe to walk around at night (around the train station not recommended!) The hotel is a mixture of traditional and contemporary - two of the floors have been renovated in a moden style, but we stayed in one of the more traditional (and cheaper) rooms. I thought the room was excellent - yes, a little traditional in style, but spotlessly clean and very spacious for a city hotel. The breakfast was amazing - a huge choice of buffet items, I could have had several helpings! The hotel also has a lovely rooftop terrace with great views over Rome - the only disappointment was that we weren't able to go here in the evenings for a drink due to dinner bookings and, when we tried to book dinner, we weren't able to because of other bookings and a wedding - it would have been helfpul if we had been told when we checked in that advance booking was necessary. However, we raised this in our review which we handed to the hotel and they have since emailed to apologise and offer us a complimentary dinner when we are next there - very good customer service. The staff were very friendly and helfpul. Other than the roof terrace thing, we don't have any negatives about this hotel - it was a really lovely hotel in a wonderful location. Tip - Santa Lucia restaurant - right beside the hotel - is great for a meal in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Our Biggest Disappointment, I'm afraid!”
Reviews.Author: chicagotraveler
Reviews.Content: Our trip begin with a rented villa in Positano (gorgeous home and area). Our next stop was the outstanding La Scalinatella in Capri (the biggest, most pleasant surprise of the trip...Capri). However, the place we most looked forward to was our beloved Rome and staying at Hotel Raphael. Our group of nine had previously stayed at Grand Minerve and Del Senato. The location is wonderful behind Piazza Navona. However, we were very disappointed in the service and rooms. Our rooms at 2:30pm weren't all ready, which is understandable (we booked 5). By our return at 6pm and first entrance into our room, the beds already received night service. Hmmm! Front desk service was professional yet curt. Restaurant recommendation was just ok. Grano was very average. Directions from front desk to the restaurant were inaccurate and led us on a bit of a goose chase and we've been to Rome two times before. The actual street wasn't on either of the hotel maps. Prior to dinner, we wanted to have a glass of wine to celebrate a birthday on the roof terrace. Service was non-existent until we fetched the waiter. Additional service for another glass was the same. Finally, I am not even sure who or how the bill was secured as we had a hard time locating anyone. Rooms sorely needed updating but could be cute but tiiiiiiny! So happy we were only here one night. We all agreed we would have made an attempt to change hotels if we were staying longer. We are so sorry this was our experience as we were all looking so forward to this well reviewed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only Relais & Chateau in central Rome is worth every Penney”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a very bustling area of Rome. You expect everything to be perfect at an R&C but this is an entire staff taking service to whole new level. Arrangements for cars, tours and restaurants via email...way before you get there. Thanks Anna. A glass of prosecco delivered anywhere in the hotel at the direction of Stephen in the restaurant. I can't say enough about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel in Sept, 2011. It's about a block from Piazza Navona, and about 3-4 blocks from the Pantheon. Our original room was probably one of the smaller ones in the hotel. We asked at the front desk if we could switch to a larger one, and the hotel graciously allowed us to move to one the next day. Overall, the staff was kind and attentive, both at the front desk and in the hotel dining room, where we had a delicious breakfast buffet each morning. The front desk also helped us with dinner reservations and a taxi to the airport. There was also a convenient taxi stand about a 1/2 block away. The room was nicely decorated, clean and the bed was terrific. Even the shower was great. The hotel also has a very nice terrace where guests can have a drink and snacks and watch the sunset over the surrounding rooftops (beautiful). We felt very comfortable staying at this hotel, and using it as our base. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Profmadams
Reviews.Content: Selected hotel via Australian website. Very good value. Great location - could walk to all main places and sights in Rome. Brekky was a good size buffet and on roof top garden at level 6. Rooms not huge but good and nice bathroom. Wifi worked and was free. Loved having pre-dinner wine on roof top while seeing the sun go down on St Peter's basilica.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Service - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveller99
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in September - Wonderful experience - Front Desk came out and got our bags from cab - 2 minutes later we ere checked in - when you're exhausted from travelling on a train from Venice, this was the beginning of a very pleasant stay. All hotels should recognize what people say about first impressions is true. Things continued well - we were upgraded to a suite on the 4th floor - wonderful size - great marble bath. Great bedding and linens and fantastic air conditioning (there was a hot spell going on). Greeted by a bottle of italian champagne and strawberries - and had a little plate of cookies or creme brulees delivered every day. Breakfast buffet was fantastic - fresh, spotless, and flawless coffee and table service. This was included in the rate - I think we paid about 390 euros a night - so it wasn't cheap - but early September is considered high season. Buffet was very extensive - meats, cheeses, eggs, fresh fruit cocktail, etc. Hotel appeared to be full - but the breakfast buffet was never croweded - very professional staff. Roof bar / restaurant is wonderful - pricey drinks (8 euros for a Peroni) but an amzaing view, and again, great service. Worth every penny. Wonderful front desk recommended authentic Italian restaurants - and they were dead on perfect. One last thing - when trying to print boarding passes the night before leaving - had some systems issues on their PC - a staff member walked by - tried to help, finally gave up - they left, and next thing we knew, they took us to their other computer and got it done - without us asking for help! All hotels should treat their guests like this one does. lastly, and this is separate from reviewing the "hotel" is the location - it's perfect - directly (about 100 feet away) from the nicest Piazza in rome - Piazza Navona - perfect walkable distances to Vatican, Spanish Steps, Panthenon, Trevi Fountain. DOZENS of restaurants nearby - and the Piazza is fantastic at night - a whole different crowd and feel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: jeanniedc
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in August for two days before a cruise. The hotel is superbly located and is a little oasis of green in a busy area. We got a warm greeting from reception when we arrived after an early transatlantic flight, including coffee and some pastries. One of our rooms was ready early which was nice. The rooms, thought not huge, were very well appointed and had beautiful bathrooms. Our room had a nice balcony. The buffet breakfast was fabulous. The few negatives included the poor wifi (it seemed to only work in the lobby), and some temporary glitches which should not have occurred in a high end hotel (one elevator broke for a while, room keys throughout the hotel malfunctioned for a while). The only other negative was that occasionally there only seemed to be one person working at the front desk; he was very nice and helpful, but got busy at times. Overall, however, I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel Dressed Like a 5 Star (but still a 4 star)”
Reviews.Author: NYSojourner
Reviews.Content: This hotel, near the Vatican, is a Relaix and Chateau property. It was fairly tough to get to because of, presumably, temporary street closures. It is in a great location near Piazza Navona which is spectacular (except for the awful restaurants that line the place). The hotel is in a very old beautiful building but given the high rack rate, the hotel was not worth the extra dollars as it was not terribly impressive as a 5 star hotel. As a 4 star hotel at two-thirds of what we spent I would recommend it highly and stay there again. I would not stay there again next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “luxury in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Robocob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on part of our honeymoon trip after getting married in Sorrento. We had booked the Richard Meier Executive suite and on arrival they said they were upgrading us to a suite - I'm not sure what the difference was (maybe it was the deluxe suite) but the room was pretty impressive. Not big at all, but very well appointed; electric blinds; remote controlled adjustable bed, extremely comfortable; walk in wardrobe; bang & olufsen flat screen built in; lighting in the room is second to none; designer sliding screens everywhere. And the bathroom is sensational with a double walk-in shower, Bulgari toiletries plus all the usual bathroom fittings all finished to the highest standard. The room also had a small balcony overlooking the little square by the hotel entrance, very quaint and we shared a complimentary bottle of Champagne there on the first evening :) Breakfast is first class as you would expect, buffet style but everything you could possibly want and beautifully presented, even the lemon for the smoked salmon comes in a little muslin bag to retain the pips. The rooftop terrace is the major draw here, we had afternoon coffee there on the first afternoon, which was complimentary, and then dinner the second night. The views over Rome are spectacular, particularly the view of the Vatican. Food almost takes second place to the ambience, but is very good and nice sized portions too for a high end restaurant. Food & Wine is reasonably priced but beers and coffee are ridiculously overpriced, I think we paid EUR 8 +6 for a Cappuccino and Espresso. Best of all though is the location, right around the corner from Piazza Navona in the heart of the Centro Storico and so many great bars and restaurants within walking distance.Last time we were in Rome we walked everywhere, this time on honeymoon we took taxis to our starting point each morning and walked from there; the central location makes this affordable just EUR 10 to the Borghese and Terme di Caracalla, and sightseeing is not so exhausting! Staff are very friendly and helpful, they pre-booked tickets for us in advance for the Galleria Borghese and arranged a transfer to the hotel on arrival. Coming back in the afternoon after sightseeing we found bottled water and canapes in the room, a nice touch, and after dinner there's a turn down service with a little boxed chocolate each....small things but they all add up. We stayed for 3 nights and it is expensive but you get what you pay for, we will stay here again next time in Rome for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pleamar
Reviews.Content: The best location in Rome near Piazza Navonna and a few meters from Piazza Spagna . The rooms have a nice decoration ,the breakfast is very complete in a dream place. All the hotel transport you at other time...........the trees in the fronts are unics in the zone A real oasis in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHennessy
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, we always stay at the Raphael. The service is wonderful and staff very helpful. The location near to the Piazza Navona is perfect for the children to run amok and enjoy the sights. The antiques/shopping near to the hotel is lovely for a stroll to the local gelateria. The Hotel's roof top bar and restaurant with it's amazing 360 degree views is divine - the staff on the rooftop bar are superb and always make you feel special. One downside is we stayed with 3 young children and had two interconnecting suites which oddly didn't have a locking outer door (so the two rooms had to be individually locked at night) - something about a fire hazard, but we thought a bit silly. I love this hotel as my husband and I have been staying at it for the last 12 years and always enjoy coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a problem”
Reviews.Author: mdrileynyc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, beautiful terrace restaurant, and helpful staff. But I've stayed in many hotels and I've never seen such a terrible internet connection. Stayed here more than once, so it's apparently a chronic problem. If you depend on an internet connection, I suggest you stay in another hotel since the one here disconnects for 15 or more second stretches every few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “every detail covered”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler82
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights and it was tremendous. yes, quite expensive but....unlike some expensive places, this one delivers. we arrived hot and tired and they were quite welcoming. we were kindly upgraded, they had our bassinette request taken care of, they politely offered advice on places to see or eat. we went to the rooftop restaurant/bar for a snack and they comped our first drinks and were so welcoming.....it went like this during our stay. overall the room is beautiful, well appointed and the staff super courteous and warm, the breakfast was delicious, and of course the location couldn't be better just off Navona.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel,excellent location,back again”
Reviews.Author: geo007
Reviews.Content: Booked Richard Meier executive suite through relais & chateaux website. Arrived in the hotel 16:00 hs by taxi from Fiumicino Airport. Porter was in the front door,greated me with a smile,said " Welcome to Hotel Raphael " and took care of the luggage. Check in fast and efficient.Stayed in the same room that was booked,a little expensive ( EUR 456.00 including breakfast ),a Richard Meier Executive Suite. Bathroom has adequate size,2 showers,thick towels,separate bath and shower area. Bulgari amenities. Very good location,from the bed in the suite to Piazza Navona is less than 3 minutes!!!! Lots of restaurants,tratorias," tavola caldas " in the proximities. Breakfast very good,with french butter,french brie cheese,fresh orange juice and a very good expresso coffee. Waiters are always paying attention on you,if you need anything don't have to look for and wait. Also have to mention the concierge Domenico,very courteous,efficient,ready to make all restaurant reservations you need,. The only drawbacks were: WI FI only works in the reception area,not in the suites; noise from glass broken in the back of the hotel (right below my suite's window ) tuesdays,thursdays and saturdays early in the morning ( garbage glass selective collectors from the city of Roma,they explained ) It's my second visit to Roma in the end of july,and I'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless - made for a perfect holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mumsytiger
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my parents and children. The hotel itself was beautifully appointed, and luxurious, and clean. The photographs really do not lie. The buffet breakfast was fresh and well-stocked throughout the morning with a large variety of hot and cold items, salad, fruits, and fresh baking. The location could not be better, on a quiet street just off of Piazza Navona, with ample excellent restaurants on the same street. We went at peak tourist season, in a very hot week in August, however the hotel was well airconditioned, and well maintained. What made the stay most exceptional, however, was the extremely attentive, polite, and helpful staff of the hotel - from providing maps and directions to all of the sites (all within easy walking distance), to opening the breakfast room a little early when we had an early tour of the vatican museums. I highly recommend this excellent hotel, and we will certainly return! PS The only downside, I must add, was the fact that the rooftop terrace was only for the bar and restaurant, so not possible to spend the evening on the terrace unless you were a customer at the restaurant, which is unlike the other hotels we stayed at in Venice and Florence which was always our favourite way to end the day.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: corkboy73
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault this beautiful hotel - particularly on arrival where we were upgraded to a deluxe Meier room and it's superb location just off Piazza Navonna. The facade and lobby area give a great first impression, and the rooms live up to expectations also - deluxe has plenty of space, super comfy beds and attractive wood decor while the large bathroom has double sink/double shower/separate bath . We had complementary sparkling wine waiting in our room, while the breakfast buffet tempts you to back up for seconds. The service was as you would expect from a 5* hotel - very pleasant and efficient but not obstrusive. The roof terrace is nice for a drink though a little expensive. For walking around Rome the location is ideal and central to all major places of interest - just bring comfortable shoes for walking on cobbles all day. The taxi rank is around the corner if needed. It also has wonderful restaurants within 5 min walk (try Osteria dell Anima for casual dining outside the door of hotel or Osteria Del Pegno for a genuine Italian occassion). Overall it had everything we needed for a 3 night stay, and we would certainly return when in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Pure class”
Reviews.Author: chillaJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 wonderful nights. Initially we booked a standard room, but after viewing, opted for a suite instead with balcony with great views of the eternal city. The upgrade was expensive but good value, and done with grace. The staff here are understated but kind and efficient, nothing seems to ruffle their feathers. But what a location, one can just stumble out the door and find everything that is great about Rome. Rome is one of my favourite cities int he world, and I will be trying to stay here on every occasion in the future. Make sure to linger over one of the best breakfasts you will ever have.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ArtHeathrowFl
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was superb. The staff was courteous and attentive to all our needs(which were many) We were upgraded to the suite with adjustable beds. The room was clean and very roomy. The location was fantastic with close proximity to all the tourist venues as well as the Piazza Navona. The breakfast was excellent and left us filled until dinner. I would definietly recommend this wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - Good Hotel - some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: princess416
Reviews.Content: Our family booked 4 rooms here for 2 nights prior to our cruise in early July. The hotel is well maintained and lovely. The location is perfect! The rooms are small - normal for Europe - with the comfort room being extremely small but nice large bathroom. Fine for a single, but a couple would have difficulty in such a small room. The classics are better. We also booked a Meier suite. The suite proved to be unaaceptable due to the absense of a stand up shower. Although we were told that the hotel was fully booked, the suite was changed to a smaller non Meier suite which had a shower but the air conditioning did not function! The room was changed again the next day to another Meier suite which had a shower and was lovely. Although the recovery from the issues was well taken care of and a credit was offered - we were left with the inpression that the front desk reception team would tell us things that may or may not have been completely reliable. When questioned about the rate difference on the Meier suite to the smaller classic suite - there was a comment that it was more money, which seemed unbelievable. Upon check out - we were told although there was a credit due, they would process this later and took an imprint of the card. Time will tell if the credit was applied. To be fair, the hotel was very, very nice. The breakfasts were wonderful. Amenities were excellent and the rooftop bar was lovely. There are no complaints on a technical basis. Just a nagging feeling that somehow the staff has a bit of an issue with exceeding expectations. They MET expectations but not more. For the price paid and for the Relais et Chateaux rating, we had expected a bit more. We booked and prepaid 3 rooms and a suite almost a year ago. We asked for 3 rooms be close together as there were 2 minor children in one of the rooms. We did realize the Meier room was on a different floor. The rooms were on the same floor but in 3 different corners. When asked to move them closer, we were told the hotel was fully booked. We were told that they were "upgraded" rooms and that is why they were not together. Not sure about that "fact". In fact, it turned out that there were a few "suites" availalble as we found out when the suite was changed 3 times. We asked for restaurant recommendations for a family with children, there seemed to be some competing ideas between the front desk and when our reservation from one was changed by another, some raising of voices was heard in the back....could it have been due to some "kickbacks"? I don't know......it was just a thought at the time. The bottom line - if you can get the hotel at a good price, it is a marvelous location with great amenities. It is a lovely small and intimate hotel - clean and comfortable and well maintained. Perhaps a little more training of the front desk in exercising discretion is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dakota3
Reviews.Content: This really is a great little hotel, we stayed in one of the executive Richard Meiers rooms. Quiet, comfortable room with spacious bathroom, with lots of nice little touches - there was a dish of hors d'oeuvres in the room on our arrival and every subsequent evening, plus fresh fruit, chocolates and flowers every day. Good breakfast, lots of choice and relaxed dining room. Nice terrace, we didn't have dinner on the terrace as there are loads of little restaurants and bars surrounding the hotel serving excellent food and wine at reasonable prices - you also get to do a bit of people watching that way! Thoroughly recommend this hotel, friendly, helpful staff, fantastic location. Everything within 10-20 minute walk. Pre-book all your tickets and avoid the queues. We booked tickets to the Pope's General Audience on the Wednesday (take an umbrella for shade and plenty of water - there are vendors just outside St Peters selling both - as you will be there for some time and it gets really hot!) and a tour of the Vatican Gardens, which was very relaxing, and tickets to the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel through the Vatican's website - much cheaper that a tour operator. Try Camponeschi, a restaurant near the Piazza Campe dei Fiori, the best food we had in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Lifebender
Reviews.Content: My wife, mother and I spend 4 days at this *****L HOTEL. The only benefit you have is the location of this hotel, near Plaza Navone. This is the Place du Tertre of Rome. Wireless is available, only in the lobby at 3 feet from the transmitter, not very comfortable. In the rooms ( at 350 Euro / night ) you have to pay for it !!! As welcome there was a fruit basket in the room, with a rotten kiwi and rotten apple. The minibar is not payable, the bathroom is only accessible for one person and some rooms have only one small window. Toilet paper was forgotten by the room service, showering is difficult with the fluctuation of the warm water, it goes constantly from hot to lukewarm , not very *****L On our day of departure we had to leave at 7:30 am, breakfast should be served at 7:00. Not this time, at 7:15 not everything was ready on the buffet-for € 28,00 / pp. Sad! The beds tough, were fantastic, we slept very good! Conclusion: For that price and *****L you should expect more, certainly wireless and better service. I think it should be rated 4 * Max.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel .....worth every penny!!”
Reviews.Author: klindenbaum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raphael for 2 nights at the end of our 2 week Italian vacation and it was perfect. We had been in Tuscany for a week so were excited to get to a big city and nice hotel and this far exceeded our expectations. We stayed in a Richard Meyer suite which was fabulous - large room with large bathroom. We were greeted with a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room when we arrived - which was unexpected and delightful!! The staff was very friendly and nice - the nicest of any place we stayed the whole 2 weeks. We will always stay at the Raphael when we return to Rome now!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BobHarpenden
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in two adjoining Richard Meyer rooms. They were spacious and well-equipped, with high-quality furnishings and large bathrooms. Maid service and turndown was very efficient. Breakfast was very good and we enjoyed an excellent dinner on the terrace one evening, with fantastic views over the city. The hotel is extremely well located: close to Piazza Navona and many restaurants within walking distance. Yet, our rooms were also quiet, facing on to the back of the hotel. Excellent service from the reception staff who helped with planning sightseeing and our airport transfers. Will definitely return when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive...worth it!!!”
Reviews.Author: bfu132
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel!! Amazing location, great breakfast, turn down service every night and a bottle of champagne, large spacious suite, comfortable beds and pillows. Great service. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location (not cheap tho)”
Reviews.Author: BabyBearLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: I have already recommended this hotel to friends, the service was very welcoming and they could not do enough to help you. Location was great for Piazza Navona, plus around the corner is Della Pace (would highly recommend going for people watching and meals, but very busy with locals). 15 mins easy walk to Vatican, little bit further to Col'eum, so remember your comfy shoes. The roof top terrace is lovely and great for putting your feet up with a beer, after busy sight-seeing days. We will definately go back to this hotel - only small criticism is that air-con kept bedroom very cool, so were chilly and couldn't turn it down - loved the walk in wardrobe! See also review of Dark Rome tours - also recommended. Next time we would pre-book a private car collection with hotel from airport as cheaper than getting a cab from airport (our booked taxi didn't turn up).

Reviews.Title: “Great location is about all”
Reviews.Author: Jack Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights & concluded that the best thing about this hotel is the location. All other items about the hotel & staff was just above average for the price we paid. The value rating is way down comparing it to other lodging in Europe. Staff at the counter are very pretentious and almost rude. They seem too busy chating with co-workers or on their computers to notice your presents. Our room had cool features such as electric shades & motorized tilting mattress ...too bad they didn't work & couldn't be repaired during our stay. Also ordered drinks on the rooftop terrace & received small bite-sized treats that we didn't order & thought they were complimentary - not so, an extra 12 euros. So little stuff like this is upsetting and shouldn't happen for a *****Relais & Chateaux hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: westfen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the R. Meier suites with a little terrace and it was just lovely. Very charming and helpful staff. First class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: kobe22
Reviews.Content: Our second stay here in 12 months and the service from this hotel is enough to make me want to return to Rome, just so I can stay here again!!!! The location is second to none and we have been able to walk to all the main sights from here. We have stayed in three different rooms at this hotel and they have all been fabulous. The buffet breakfast is very good and the rooftop is a pleasant area to enjoy a drink or two after a long day of sight seeing. We were left 'tasty treats' on our room every day and we love the adjustable beds.The staff at the front desk are very helpful and friendly and the doorman was a delight!!!! Hopefully we'll see you again next year!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Raval001
Reviews.Content: First hotel on our honeymoon and what a great hotel! First the basics, clean clean clean, ac works, and hot water. Now to the superb services, turn down service every night with box of chocolates wrapped in leather box and ribbon as well. Free spa slippers always strategically placed next to daily clean white cloths on the floor for when u wake up. Rooms are so quiet and dark With the automatic drapes that you never know if it's morning or night! Location right next door to piazza navona! The hotel had Bose speakers throughout our room and in the shower (which had double shower heads!) Also, another basic was that every morning we got a new set of toiletries. That may sound basic, but another hotel which will remain unamed only gave us one nights worth of soap for four nights! Even Howard Johnson did better than that. Anyways, raphael's breakfast is a dream! Fresh food, mixed salad, crispy onion rings, fruits, cheeses, everything! The service at breakfast was amazing! Also, their beds have remote controls to recline, sit up, or elevate your feet! Again, this is worth every penny for a restful and pampered life! Thanks for a wonderful hotel. Only draw back was the front desk. Maybe it was a language barrier, but don't expect smiles. They do their job, that's about it with no added sugar. Heck that's the only complaint I have.

Reviews.Title: “Super Spectacular!!”
Reviews.Author: Higgens
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 10 days in Rome! Stayed at Hotel Raphael, what a wonderful experience! Location for this hotel is so very convenient we were able to walk most everywhere we wanted to go. The staff is very kind and helpful. The only negative I have about the hotel itself is the restaurant on site is a little spendy, but what you would expect for a "5-star" hotel. The room was very clean, and maintained with the maid turning down the bed every evening, along with the hugely addictive chocolates they leave for your "midnight" sweet tooth! Overall wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: celticmoon
Reviews.Content: Long overdue review, but we stayed in this hotel for 10 days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Delicious, plentiful breakfasts. Wonderful rooftop memories of dinner and drinks. Helpful staff. (Did have a glitch with the air conditioning running too cold, but this was minor). Shops and restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in superb location next to Piazza Navona”
Reviews.Author: GovernorPhil
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded on arrival to a suite - tv in lounge area as well as in bedroom, walk in dressing area, beautiful bathroom with full size bath. breakfasts were excellent; good choices of hot and cold. Drinks (beer, wine) horrendously expensive, cheaper to buy a bottle of Chianti at local shop than to buy a glass in the hotel bar. Despite this last remark, this is truly an exceptional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the PERFECT hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trishpatti
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of hotels in Rome and none can match the Raphael. The willingness of the staff to be helpful and friendly, from the housekeepers to the front desk is beyond all expectation. They arranged for a tour guide for us, recommended restaurants and were engaging and accurate. The location could not be better. All Rome is walkable from here. I will never stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid, absolutely perfect ambiance, service and food”
Reviews.Author: ellen080
Reviews.Content: A little piece of heaven in an amazing area of Rome. Modern luxury, incredible bedding, bathrooms, televisions, service. The showers were amazing and big enough for two. Every single person on the staff of the hotel was committed to being as solicitious and helful and possible. The restaurant was excellent, the pastas from heaven, and the service impeccable! The head waiter in the restaurant was charming and delightful and when one of our companions asked if he had ice tea, he simply brewed it and served it fresh!! The buffet breakfast was excellent and had something for every one, fresh meats, cheese, fresh fruit, eggs, pastries, etc. and everything was delicious, coffee was poured immediately the pastry was still warm from the oven. The location just off the Pizza Navona, was perfect right in the center of everything, blocks from the Pantheon and within walking distance to major sites. Lots of wonderful restaurants around, antiques, art, shopping, strolls on the Piazza Navona at night!! We were in a Richard Meir room and it was worth every penny. The rooms were immaculate and freshened several times a day. Fresh fruit and pastry was complimentary each day, the beds turned down, with slippers next to the bed and chocolates--really no stone was unturned to make a guest feel welcomed!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and service: Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: thejenniekim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Raphael for 5 nights on business, with the hope of being close enough to the sights to enjoy the tourist attractions as a first-time visitor to Rome. For this goal, I could not have picked a more perfect hotel. My top priorities when choosing a hotel: Location/convenience, good internet connection, cleanliness (including linens), comfy beds. Hotel Raphael delivered on all of these things and much more. Service was impeccable, characteristic of the R&C line. The housekeeping service somehow knew when I had left and timed the cleanings (daily and turn down) perfectly. I did not get a single "knock knock housekeeping," nor did I return to a not-yet-clean room once during my 6-day/5-night stay. I honestly can't remember the last time that's happened. I wish all hotels would pay attention to details like this. Reception was friendly and supremely competent. The phone didn't even ring when I pressed for the concierge -- he was already on the line and waiting to assist. When I requested an ethernet cable from reception, it arrived in less than 3 minutes. Wired internet was fast (14 min to download an episode of 30 Rock from iTunes) and free. Wireless (used the hotel lobby wifi log-in and signal) was slightly less fast, but more than adequate, and also free using the lobby's network. The room itself was clean, spacious, modern and well-lit (booked one of the Richard Meier doubles on the 3rd floor). Not a great view (facing a stone building next door), but not bad and there were 2 large windows for plenty of light. The room smelled faintly of smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. The hallways also smelled of smoke once in a while, but it's hard to find a true non-smoking hotel in Rome. Also, the doors to the hallway weren't well insulated so I could hear people coming to and fro. Bed was two twins abutting each other to make a king -- each side was adjustable to elevate your head and legs. Insanely comfortable. One of the nicest hotel bathrooms I've seen in Europe. Toiletries were Bulgari, and the hotel presented me with a boxed Bulgari gift set upon departure. Delicious free breakfast buffet every morning -- lots of great fresh fruit, in addition to gourmet pastries, hot foods and meat. I haven't even gotten to the best part yet: Location. Hotel Raphael is adjacent to Piazza Navona, the most charming and picturesque of all Rome's piazzas, and nestled in the historic center, within a 5 minute walk to Pantheon, 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes to Spanish Steps, 15 minutes to the Colosseum and Roman Forum, and less than 30 minutes to the Vatican across the bridge. I didn't realize what a huge city Rome is, so being able to walk to all the great monuments was hugely convenient. There are also a number of good restaurants nearby -- best pasta of my life next door at the renowned Santa Lucia. Around the corner is authentic Italian pizza at Focaccia. It's a 10 minute walk to Piazza Lucenzo for some of the best gelato in Rome (San Crispino and Della Palma) and a great, reasonably priced homestyle meal at Matricianella. Finally, the front desk and bellmen were a pleasure at every interaction. Very professional and helpful. I will definitely stay at Hotel Raphael again, and would recommend it to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “the right kind of attention”
Reviews.Author: halfbakedtv
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research before I stayed here and I writing to report that there could not have been a nicer hotel staff. Unlike some of the less flattering reviews that I read here I was not disappointed at all, and I wasn't even one of the high rollers. From the front desk, to the breakfast room, to the people that were the room cleaning staff, everyone did their job at a high level of excellence. Granted this is a 5 star hotel, but they do not seem to take that for granted, they seem to want to maintain that high level of service. My husband was a huge fan of the Breakfast buffet, and it was worth it (Blood Orange Juice was off the hook) Location was awesome, as was the fact that January is Sale month at all the shops, tripadvisor readers take note: January is SALDE month in Rome, and there were lots and they were good!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: kmdinny
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raphael is located just a few steps from Piazza Navona on a beautiful and charming street. We stayed at the hotel for a week over New Years' and had a delightful dinner and enjoyed the beautiful fireworks over the city from their rooftop restaurant. The hotel and restaurant staff were very courteous, spoke fluent English and were extremely helpful with our needs. Overall the room and bathroom were adequate but extremely small. We ran low on bathroom toiletries a few times which was annoying (i.e., soap, toilet paper, shampoo and tissue) and upholstered headboard was very dusty, but these shortcomings were soon forgotten by us because of the outstanding service, restaurant and comfort offered by this terrific hotel and its staff. The breakfast buffet was fabulous, internet service and gym convenient. I would highy recommend this hotel and would stay there again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, shame about the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: exonx2
Reviews.Content: I give Hotel Raphael three and a half out of five for the hotel itself, not including the restaurant. It is in an excellent location, very central indeed for the historic centre of Rome. The rooms are very good, although we did have some problems with getting the air-conditioning at a temperature we liked. It took several phone calls to reception, and we spent one night having difficulty sleeping as it was so hot. Otherwise the rooms are very clean, with good facilities as one would expect. The staff are helpful, although there isn't the same personal touch we've experienced in other Relais & Chateaux hotels. However, I would warn any visitor away from the hotel restaurant. We visited in winter, so the roof restaurant was not open. The ground floor restaurant was empty when we arrived for dinner on a Friday evening at 8.30pm. Generally speaking, the food was overpriced. We did not receive what we would expect for €150 for two courses (including a €48 bottle of wine, which did not seem worth the money) for two people. When we ordered my wife explained she was vegetarian, and the waiter confirmed that her choices were vegetarian. An additional starter was brought, which was fish. When my wife queried this, no substitute was offered. Then the ordered starter arrived, which was supposed to be goat's cheese and mango salad. There was no obvious sign of mango, very little goat's cheese, but there were large strips of bacon. Not vegetarian. Having removed the bacon herself, my wife was faced with what amounted to a €26 pile of lettuce with a tiny amount of goat's cheese. My food was fine, but nothing special. We were simply left flabbergasted by the way in which the staff didn't seem to care about my wife's dietary requirements. The breakfast was a good buffet with lots of variety, but again the service left something to be desired. The waitress showing guests to their tables repeatedly answered the phone while doing so, and seemed extremely impersonal. Despite being one of only two couples in the restaurant all evening, we felt completely neglected by the three waiting staff who seemed completely uninterested. We left without pudding.

Reviews.Title: “In one word: fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Wereldreiziger
Reviews.Content: Last august we´ve stayed at The Raphael. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suit. So we had a little private balcony at the back of the hotel. We were a bit tired (don´t take the train form the airport, arrange the private transfer instead). But that was soon to be forgotten when we discovered the fresh fruits and a bottle of Champaign. Since we weren’t able to empty that bottle at once, the staff filled the ice bucket with fresh ice and closed the bottle with a cork. Something we did not expect. The location is great. Everything is within walking distance. Busses are nearby. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The made some reservations for us. The hotel itself is tastefully decorated. Lots of classic furniture. The Richard Meier rooms are totally different, but despite the modern architecture still cozy and warm. We didn´t have dinner at the rooftop restaurant. But it´s certainly worthwhile to have a drink (or more) at night. The view is lovely and they even have a small bench to put your bag on.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: Ellen H
Reviews.Content: I researched for months for the perfect place to spend the holidays in Rome, this was it! Location is so important and this was centrally located, just off Piazza Navona on a little side street and yet out the door and 10-15 min walk to anything you want to do or see. We were on foot the entire 8 days with the exception of 1 short taxi ride due to down pouring rain. We had our 22 year old daughter with us so the Bramante Suite (504) was perfect, twin bed brought in, lots of closet space, private terrace. Nice room, classic style but that suits me when in Rome I don't want a ultra modern design. Bathtub and larger shower w/ 2 rain showers in it! Bvalgari products. Breakfast included which was great to start the day, simple but lovely. The staff is super friendly and helpful, multilingual, love the top hat of the door man. if you are looking for a great location in the midst of things, luxury and a caring staff this is the place for you. I highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: TravelproNYC56
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite upon our arrival, and it only got better each day. The location is perfect for accessing all the historic sights on foot, and there were tons of fantastic restaurants right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderfull!!!”
Reviews.Author: LanaDaniel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raphael was the last stop during our Honemoon and it turned out to be our favorite. We could not have picked out more perfect place. We stayed in a beautifull Richard Meyer room. It is extremely modern! Everything from the blinds to the most comfortable bed in the world was operated with the touch of the button. Every time we left the room we came back to very clean room with a treat on the bed and a fabulous fresh pastries and fresh fruit on our table. It truly was the most amasing hotel starting with the location, staff, gorgeous roof top terrace with complimentary drinks upon our arrival to a fabulous gift upon our deparcher. We had complimentary breakfast with our room, and what a great breakfast it was! This truly was the place we didn't want to leave! It's pricy, but if you can swing it, beleive me it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome, Great food, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Gandaratravels
Reviews.Content: For me it's all about the location, but the rooms are nice (very 'European'), the food is great, and the staff really go out of their way.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs a remodel”
Reviews.Author: JunkyardWisdom
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay in Hotel Raphael because of the incredible location. This did not disappoint. The staff were helpful and friendly, the morning breakfast was good, and the bones of the facility itself were fine. But the hotel needs a remodel. It's showing it's age, and some sprucing up is in order. And seriously, WiFi only in the common areas? It's the 21st century, guys. Bottom line, I'd go again if I was looking for a well located, comfortable hotel with an excellent staff. But don't expect a 5-star experience or facility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Fazinho
Reviews.Content: The staff here are so friendly and do everything they can to help - The hotel itself is very nice but maybe not a top end 5 star. The place is expensive but so is most of Rome. If you get a chance ensure you dine at the rooftop restaurant - The views are stunning - Food excellent and the Service from the Brummie-Roman waite is top notch - Also a great location - Just of Piazza Navona and within walking distance of all tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Sologirl108
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend Hotel Raphael as it was perfect for my solo holiday. Hotel Staff were excellent in making my stay comfortable. The hotel is perfectly situated in Piazza Navona so close to dining and shopping and of course historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateatlionsgate
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at Hotel Raphael in June. Chose the hotel specifically for it's location--we'd had reservations at Hotel Eden but changed to this hotel and based purely on that, do not have one regret. The location cannot be beat--we walked everywhere and the amount of restaurants to chose from so close to the hotel after a long day was abundant. The hotel itself is nice, reception was decent--just not very personal--however, we were kindly upgraded to the Richard Meier rooms--very modern, clean and spacious rooms. Our friends stayed on one side of the hotel and us on the other, and between us our one major concern was the exterior noise. We had lovely views but things outside on the alleys do not quiet down until very late and then the trucks roll in very early--so I'd definitely suggest interior rooms if quiet is essential. We could have requested to do this and in all fairness did not, as we were unpacked and just dealt with it--it wasn't horrible but worth a mention for those who are sensitive to noise. The gym is old and the equipment very old--so my husband and I actually joined a gym at another hotel for the duration of our stay. The buffet breakfast was also good, eggs, sausage, coldmeats, pastries etc. Had afternoon snack on a beautiful day on the rooftop restaurant--view is great.. Overall, we all found it to be a nice hotel with a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it, why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: kswright
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewers, I have to say this hotel is close to perfect. The rooms aren't as large as I would have liked (we were upgraded for an 8 night stay from a deluxe to one of the Richard Meier ultra-modern rooms on the two "executive" floors). I had been to Rome once before and, on the recommendation of friends, stayed in a fancy hotel on the Via Veneto. The Via Veneto area is sterile and not fun and we didn't really enjoy our stay there. But the Raphael, just off Piazza Navona in the historical center, is a whole other story. You walk out the door and you're right there, in the midst of everything. As befits a Relais & Chateaux hotel, everything is elegant and the staff and service are the best. Really, the only problem is paying the bill at the end!!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Loves2CtheWorld
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. It's in a 'super' convenient location just off the Piazza Navona. The Staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are quiet, clean, and comfortable and having breakfast included made for an easy start every morning. We were traveling with a six year old and having the ability to stop in to the hotel for a break midday made our trip much more enjoyable. Being on the Piazza also gave us a steady source of entertainment. The neighborhood restaurants were better than we expected, given the touristy location. We were able to fine great pizzas, simply paninis and full blown three course meals all within walking distance of the hotel. The Hotel restaurant is also good, but VERY expensive. I suggest having a nightcap or desert one evening. The view is worth the price of admission. We loved Rome and will return again, hopefully to the Raphael.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Raphael with our three year old daughter and we loved it. We stayed in a room with a small terrace, room 418, and it was glamourous and exquisite. A couple of friends joined us on the trip and their rooms were more average -- they had wished they had booked a room like ours. Definitely pay a little extra for the better room.The tile work, the linens and bedding, everything was fabulous. Our shades were electric, there was a light in the closet, we had a fresh fruit basket in our room every day. . . everything was intentional and deliberately glamorous. Even the shower had two shower heads and the stream was the strongest I think I have ever had in a shower. But it also had the personal touch. We asked for a baby cot for our daughter and the staff put in a soft Winnie the Pooh comforter and turned it down for her. If we go back to Rome, we will stay here again. They give you a free drink coupon for the rooftop deck . . .make sure you enjoy it. We loved the view and they give you a wonderful sampling of hors d'oeuvres to go with it.

Reviews.Title: “Still perfection.”
Reviews.Author: usasnob
Reviews.Content: We started our recent trip in Italy with 3 nights at the Raphael. After a few days in Venice and in Florence, we moved to a private villa in Tuscany and then spent a final night at the Raphael before flying back to the states from Rome. I used to stay in the Raphael many years ago, but in recent years had switched to the Hotel Eden for reasons I don't now recall. I won't make that error again. There is no more perfect location in all of Rome. From the threshold of the Raphael you can practically look down a tiny alleyway to see Bernini's statues on the Piazza Navona. Though the P.N. is throned with tourists in the summer, in the Rapahel you feel as if they are miles away. The hotel is exquisitely private and quiet. It's covered over with green vines so it seems to magically disappear into the walls of the church behind it. Rooms are lovely, beds are perfection. Bulgari toiletries in all the baths and lovely soft robes and slippers. Stunning breakfast every morning, great fitness room for a workout. If you don't have a drink at dusk on the rooftop terrace, you'll miss one of the great views of Rome. When we arrived in Rome, the hotel upgraded one of our rooms to a large suite. The staff here is impeccable. They booked museum tours, suggested fabulous restaurants and did a multitude of things to make our stay pleasant. When we returned for our final night in Rome, they greeted us like long lost family, again upgraded us to a suite and organized everything impeccably for our early morning departure to Fuimicino. We were travelling with a 10, 14 and 18 year old, though in the past we had stayed at the Raphael singly or as a couple. The hotel is lovely for honeymooners, but it also works brilliantly for families. Because the Piazza Navona is right out the front door, we let the kids come and go on their own, even at night since they were only a few steps from home. From the Raphael you can walk easily to all the places worth seeing in Rome, and when you return, you are in the lap of luxury. It's not easy to become a Chateau &Relais Hotel because the standards are very high, but the Raphael meets them easily. Kudos in particular to its fine staff, and I'm still dreaming of the lovely matresses and luxurious bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raphael for 3 nights and we had an enjoyable stay there. Upon arrival we were upgraded to one of the newly renovated Richard Meier rooms, which was very nice, with a spacious bathroom and clever use of the available space. The hotel corridors could benefit from a decoration as they were a bit plain, and the elevator needs a small facelift, but nonetheless it was fuctional and the guest doesn't spend any time there. Breakfast was quite good, especially for Italy, and the location just off piazza Navona, ideal. The only downside is the staff, which while friendly and kind, didn't go beyond their duties for advice etc.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: buzylizzy
Reviews.Content: We saw the hotel last time we were in Rome and decided that, if we were to return, we would stay at the Rapheal based on its location and beautiful, ivy-clad appearance. So, for our wedding anniversary, we booked a three night stay and I am so glad that we did. On arrival, we were shown to our room which had been upgraded due to it being a special occasion. The room was fantastic; it was well furnished and modern and it had it's own terrace overlooking a church - we were delighted. The manager had left us a note welcoming us and there was a bottle of chilled prosecco, canapes and a red rose waiting for us. It was such a lovely welcome. During our stay, we had breakfast in our room which was set up for us on our terrace - the food and service were faultless. We also had cocktails on the roof terrace which is a gorgeous location; the drinks were quite pricey but came with snacks. The service on the roof terrace was a little slow although it gave us chance to admire the view and relax. I feel that I need to defend this hotel, to some extent, due to the previous reviews although it should not need any defence as it is excellent. The hotel's central location is ideal for sightseeing or just soaking up the atmosphere of the Piazza Navona, which was buzzing at all times, and yet it is quiet and peaceful inside the hotel. The staff we met were helpful and polite at all times and tried to make our stay memorable for all the right reasons. We had a fabulous break in Rome and the Raphael played a major part in this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: bklyntransplant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I learned of this hotel in a search of Relaix & Chateaux properties, a method that has not let us down in the past. Until now. The hotel has its upsides, including location, lovely roof deck and solitude -- you get a great night's sleep there -- but the service is indifferent at best, and don't bother with the overpriced food (too many other truly great places nearby). Our room was a nice size but felt in need of refurbishing (worn leather couches in the suite, moldy shower). To boot, we feel sure we left an article of clothing in the room but no one ever responded to our email requests to check ... once we checked out, we were non-entities. And we entrusted our postcards to the front desk, giving the clerk money for postage, but the postcards were never mailed. This happened to at least one other reviewer, and I never would have believed it if it hadn't happened to us. Disappointing, to say the least. We loved the location but will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch”
Reviews.Author: NDerby
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I chose this hotel. Despite some negative reviews I became fixated on it and I'm so happy I did. Stayed 5 nights in early June in a Richard Meier terrace suite. Beautiful. I don't know how anyone could complain about this hotel. We were greeted so warmly, shown around by lovely staff and when we got to our room they had wine and sandwiches for us. Every day after they cleaned our room they left us something to snack on - one day it was desserts, another fruit, etc. We were very sad to leave, even though we were going to Amalfi!!! If I ever return to Rome this is the place to be. The location is perfect, obviously, but the major memory I will always have is hanging out on the terrace surrounded by fragrant plants (honeysuckle and lemon trees) after a crazy day of walking/exploring the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good splurge in outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: lowcountrysmiles
Reviews.Content: Very elegant and comfortable hotel in a superb location. You got the amenities you would expect in this kind of property. My wife and I were there for four nights earlier this year and had a fantastic stay. Staff is sharp and courteous but do not go out of their way to be friendly. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant except for the good but overpriced breakfast. We had an excellent updated contemporary room, so can not speak for the others. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...but not much else...”
Reviews.Author: cocoaman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location to walk to all different parts of the city. It is just off the Piazza Navona and in a lively part of Rome. That is the best of it.
