We were told we were upgraded to a suite. It was a noisy room right on the street and we were woken up several times in the middle of the night. The staff lacks training and the hotel seems to lack overall management. Twice we were told, 'my colleague is new' when we were overcharged and another time we were brought the wrong item. The concierge is negative and meets most requests with hesitance. After requesting a non tourist restaurant, we were sent down the street with everyone in the restaurant speaking English. The food was mediocre, the menu in English and the service very slow. When we expressed our disappointment, a 'colleague' said, "He sends everyone there." Walls and carpet are tired throughout the hotel. I accidentally took the stairway down from the rooftop terrace (a nice amenity), and found junk along the way cluttering the stairs as if it was a storage area. The only reason to stay here is the location but I imagine there are others who actually try to take care of and accommodate their guests.

Reviews.Title: “service unbecoming a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeff800
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a room called an executive suite. In the US, this wouldn't even qualify as a junior suite. But the room was newly renovated and well-appointed. Adjustable bed, new flat panel TV, electric window shades and excellent bathroom. The restaurant on the hotel's roof has breathtaking views of the city and good to very good food. The service, however, is a completely different story. The TV system would not operate properly. A woman from the front desk came up and tried to get it working, without success. We called again and the same woman cam up, saying she had spoken with someone and could now get it working. She couldn't. I finally went downstairs looking for help from someone else. The same woman (was she the only person working?) offered to come up again. I asked her what good that would do and asked her to get someone else. She said there was no one else to get, but about a half hour later someone else did come up and get the TV working, although not fully. No request was small enough for the staff to fulfill. Each day we were given only two bath towels and two hand towels, no wash cloths or any other towels. One day we asked for extra towels and were told that there were no more clean towels in the hotel. In 6 days, the one small bar of soap in the bathroom was never changed. One more strange point, the "glasses" in the bathroom were actually plastic cups. In keeping with the standard of service, the plastic cups were never changed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel but freezing cold so stay was unpleasant.”
Reviews.Author: nick107
Reviews.Content: May 18-20 2010. Weather outside was OK but in the room was freezing. Because it was May there was no heating only airconditioning. We had to wear overcoats when in the room and the staff were not able to provide a fan heater 'for safety reasons'. The location was excellent and the executive room which had only been completed 2 weeks earlier was also excellent, but because it was so cold our stay was spoilt. Not good value at £300 per night. I would suggest going for a lastminute 'surprise 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: shac1968
Reviews.Content: charming hotel with wonderful staff. the front desk helped us with everything from tours to excellent restaurant recommendations. the location is perfect--right behind busy piazza navona on a quiet street. we walked everywhere. our rooms were classically furnished and spotless. we also had a beautiful private terrace to relax on after long days of touring. the breakfast buffet was the best we had in italy with lots of choices and wonderful service---don't forget to tip the waiters,even though the breakfast is free.they worked very hard and we saw that most of the guests didn't leave anything. the hotel is a wonderful oasis in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location near Piazza Navona!”
Reviews.Author: reyeroru
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and very nice terrace on top. Only steps away from piazza navona and 10 minutes walk from fontana de trevi. The renovated rooms are fantastic, the older rooms not so much. Has sky cable TV and free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Awful- there are far better hotels with far better staff in Rome”
Reviews.Author: George_Piblington
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful trip to Rome recently, and thankfully it was so good that the following points did not fully ruin our break. Positives: Good location, one block behind Piazza Navona Hotel and room and fittings all very classy Negatives: Very rude staff from start to finish. Reception seem to visually assess you to see if you are worth fawning over i.e. an old bat in a fur coat was treated far better than us. For reference I'm a city trader - though we are not so vulgar as to flash wealth. We had a do not disturb sign on the door at 8:30pm as my wife was feeling unwell. At 9:40pm we were rudely awoken by a phone call from reception saying "we noticed you have do not disturb on your door- do you need any fresh towels?". We were angry and confused as the room had already been cleaned that day. There was no need to intrude on our privacy. Then, on the next day we noticed a third toothbrush which had been placed in the same glass as ours in the bathroom. It was filthy, the bristles were brown and bent. I also noticed that our toothbrushes had fluff etc on them too. I complained to reception, and they gave me two replacement toothbrushes but no apology for the health hazard in the potentially malicious use of our property and the reason for the deposit of the hotel's filthy toothbrush in the same jar. On exit, the staff were again dismissive and rude. We shall be complaining also to the hotel's parent company Relais and Chateaux. We have stayed in R+C properties in Madagascar, and found no fault. I think the problem is purely with this hotel and its rude staff Stay elsewhere and enjoy this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at this hotel. I enjoy this hotel each and every time I visit. The staff is very accommodating if you need an airport transfer, taxis, etc. You are greeted warmly by name. I have stayed in a Classic, Deluxe, Junior Suite, and Navona Suite. The rooms are very comfortable and well maintained. The beds are in excellent condition with fine linen, but a bit on the hard side as is common in some European hotels. The bathrooms with marble, long tubs for soaking (not in every room), Bulgari amenities, bidets, heated towel racks, etc. are top notch. Housekeeping is invisible, but extremely good. The classic room did not have a tub, but rather a curtained shower area in the corner. The breakfast is very nice, but quite expensive. I highly recommend breakfast if included in the rate as €26 is quite high. The only minor problem that I could mention was our request for a simple restaurant. The man at the desk with the shaved head fired off a name that I misunderstood. He said it was 50 meters away and implied it was just up the street. Three days later we noticed the place and wished that he had made more of an effort to assist as it would have taken very little additional effort, but recommending restaurants may be an endeavor that they prefer to avoid. One of our favorite nearby restaurants for convenience is Sangallo which is around the corner on via Coronari. They have some nice salads and vegetable offerings that are welcome after many heavy meals. I enjoy the Raphael very much and as a result will continue to return.

Reviews.Title: “Rome at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: sabinemartens
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raphael is situated in Largo Febo, a side-street of Piazza Navona. The area is littered with small similar streets all evoking the same authentic and cosy feeling. The outside of hotel Raphael is completely covered with green climbers and right next door is a church. Upon entering you are immediately welcomed by friendly staff and this remains the same each time you walk in or out. Staff is very accomodating and makes sure everything you wish for is realized. My husband and I and our daughter of 11 stayed in room 318, a junior suite with view on to the side-street and the church. The suite was spacious with a wonderful bathroom (Bulgari products) and comfortable beds. The third bed was of the same quality as the double bed which is exactly what we had asked for. The suite also had plenty of storage space and room for luggage. A welcome snack and bottle of wine and chocolates in the evenings were part of the hotel's treats. The room could also be darkened 100% due to the special electric blinds which is probably also an asset in the summer. At the time we were there the neighbourhood was quiet and inviting. You are only a few steps away from Piazza Navona. Campo Fiori is a 5 minute walk. It takes you 15 minutes to walk to the Colloseum and about 10 minutes to the Pantheon. So actually the location couldn't be better. The hotel's first owner was an art collector and this shows in the pieces you can find throughout the hotel and restaurant. Adjacent to the lobby guests can relax and read in the library. Breakfast in the mornings is plenty and guests from all over the world will find some of their specialties in the buffet. The roof terrace is a big asset too of course. It gives you a wonderful view and you can have a drink or eat when the weather allows it. Hopefully the hotel will not become more expensive because rumour has it that next year it will be part of the Chateaux and Relais Group. One of the major points of attraction is the restaurant. Although it is a bit expensive the food is wonderful. The chef combines Italian style with his origin (Brittany in France) and his experience (restaurants in New york) and what you are served is a world of creativity. Even if you are not staying at the hotel you should eat there at least once. Complementary to the food art of the chef is the expertise of maitre Steven who is uno tresoro with a welcoming and warm personality. He makes sure you have the best of food, wine and is professional all the way. This hotel Raphael in Rome will always be my number one; in fact I will not look for another hotel because I was completely, totally happy with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Hotel Raphael and loved it. It is small but sophisticated in an understated way. The location is excellent, just off the Piazza Navona on a relatively quiet side street. Upon arrival, we were provided with a "welcome" cappuccino and cookies in the lobby -- just what we needed after our overnight flight. We were upgraded to a junior suite on the first (i.e., second) floor, and found it very comfortable. The marble bathroom had both tub and glassed-in shower, and while not roomy, it was fine for two. There were two large arched windows providing a nice view of a small courtyard along the street below; unfortunately, these were not entirely soundproof, so we could hear late-night revelers passing by until we turned on the fan to mask the street noise. It was also difficult to regulate the room temperature at night, so we were a bit warmer than we would have liked (the A/C had been turned off for the season). Despite these minor factors, the hotel was handsome and charming and the staff was universally cheery and helpful. Everyone was friendly and greeted us whenever we passed by. The lobby is brightly decorated in reds and yellows with attractive art and many inviting sofas and chairs. While the rooms are decorated with antiques, the stairs and hallways are modern in design, with chrome railings and sleek lines; it's a bit incongruous, but it works. We had drinks (reasonably priced) but no meals in the hotel. The front desk was great about calling taxis and bringing our bags promptly. There was a concierge desk, but it was never occupied during our stay; good thing we didn't need any concierge services. We plan to stay here again when we next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: judith_dhondt
Reviews.Content: Hotel Raphaël is a really great hotel in Rome. It is close to Piazza Navona. Beautiful location it really shows the old Rome. The service in the hotel is great. Also the breakfast and restaurant is delicious. Beautiful rooms. Very clean and quiet! What we missed was coffee and tea facilities in the room. It can be a little bit expensive but you pay the good quality and the beautiful location. http://www.raphaelhotel.com/

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel - best location for touring”
Reviews.Author: tim90nyc
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a true 5-star. Rooms were gorgeous. Staff at the desk seemed too young to be of any good help (concierge-wise). Skip the breakfast and go to a cafe (not right on the piazza) if you are not on an expense account. The rooms are pricey, but we got a good deal on an internet special advance purchase. Very nice roof-top restaurant. We did not eat there, but great spot for a drink in the evening overlooking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daliasdad
Reviews.Content: Great location off the Piazza Navona- walkable to ALL sites. Hotel staff great- gave us a free upgrade, as well as a bottle of Champagne the second night! Funky boutique hotel, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: ViewontheHudson
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here before our Mediterranean cruise. We stayed in one of the Richard Meier rooms. Nice Modern design. Bathroom had double rainfall shower heads – just marvelous! A comfortable King Size bed - we loved it. Very prompt and helpful service from the staff. It is a marvelous location at the Piazza Novana. Breakfast is pricey so we enjoyed the breakfast at one of he many café’s in the area. We had dinner at the roof top restaurant one night. View was amazing. Food was very good but a little on the expensive side. Definitely a hotel we would come back to the next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel within walking distance to everything!”
Reviews.Author: tm1955
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning, so our rooms were not ready. When returned later that afternoon our rooms were not only ready as promised, but we were upgraded! Our rooms were modern and of superior size than what we have found were typical for Europe. There was a fresh red rose in a vase with a complimentary tray of cheese and snacks. The hotel is located 1 block off Piazza Navona within walking distance to just about everything. The service was outstanding. We could not have asked for more! We booked this hotel through GTA hotels and got a great rate. They are different as you prepay to this company, and they give you a voucher to submit to the hotel for payment.. Since we have never utilized this company before we were a little concerned, but everything worked out fine. All things considered, this was a fantastic hotel at a great price. I would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here on every trip to Rome...you should too!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyAoregon
Reviews.Content: Absolutely unbeatable location! Quiet rooms, luxury at affordable price! Impeccable service! Only 1 block off the North end of Piazza Navona and 4 blocks from Campo de Fiore and short walk to the Pantheon. Hotel has own private car to take you to the airport. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BlossumMiami
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel when we stayed in May 2009. The location is wonderful and the hotel very charming. We stayed in a Richard Meier room which was great, clean and sleek. I also enjoyed the breakfast room in the morning; there was a large selection of food and the service was great. One night, after we asked for a recommendation for a great pizza place (hard to find in Rome), the desk manager walked us over to a small family place which we would have never found on our own and the food was yummy. I would defintely stay there again. I was I was there now.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty nice hotel, in an excellent location, yet service poor”
Reviews.Author: ssm28
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed there for our honeymoon in april 2009, & had advised them of this prior and on the day of check-in. Don't expect extra services (like champagne or room upgrades) if you are going here for your honeymoon, they just said "oh, that's nice". The front desk staff were a tad bit "snooty", but overall ok. One of them (he was the front desk "manager" so he said) tried to scam us into paying 60 euros for a cab to airport, & we declined his assistance. Then the next day we were told by another front desk employee to make sure we don't pay more than 40 euros for the cab she had called for us. So don't ask the male employees to call you a cab -- they must be in cahoots with the taxi drivers to scam the tourists! The women working there are definitely more reliable, in our experience. The hotel itself is great, it's just the service that is so poor. The room was very clean, and modern (and i am very picky). Decent size for europe -- but definitely still small for american standards. A very short walk to St. Peter's. Literally next door to Piazza Navona (but don't eat there, it's all touristy & pricey). It's also walking distance to Colosseum/Forum area, The Pantheon, & even Trevi Fountain. Yet, you'll need a taxi to go to the spanish steps area, & piazza popolo. There are no metro stations anywhere nearby this hotel. The hotel experience was overall good, however. Just try not to rely on SOME of the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not give your postcards and euros to the concierge to mail.”
Reviews.Author: mercybell
Reviews.Content: The best part of Hotel Raphael is the location. The Piazza Navona is the perfect locale, which is in walking distance to most of the main attractions. My problems with the hotel was the construction that was going on right outside our room (no. 112). My daughter and I stayed a the Hotel Raphael in Rome from Feb 24-27, 2009. On Wednesday Feb 25 I gave the front desk manager 12 euros to mail 12 postcards. It's quite apparent that he kept my money and never mailed the postcards. I always send a postcard to my home from wherever I am and I never received it nor did anyone else who I sent a card to. My daughter also gave the front desk 1 euro to mail her postcard the following day and of course that was never mailed either. I am appalled that the Manager would keep our money and apparently throw out all of our cards. Besides the euros I gave him, there is also the cost of the postcards to consider. I am sure this was not an oversite on their part because the same thing happened with my daughter's postcard (never received). This is outrageous! I would recommend the hotel only because of the location but inquire before booking to make sure the construction is completed and mail your own postcards. Very good breakfasts and room service, excellent food, stay away from the mini bar 6 euros for a mini coke!

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better”
Reviews.Author: Zonaro
Reviews.Content: Nice location and nice decoration, but a part of this there are many problems: Bad smell in the elevator, couldn't open the room door (had to call the receptionist who had to open it for me), I had to wait many hours to get an ethernet cable, the concierge was really arrogant as I told him about my problems...I could keep on writting but willl end up here, so if you go to Rome and want a nice and cosy hotel just look for another one !

Reviews.Title: “What an awful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KildareRanger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to getting married in Rome October 3rd - 8th inclusive, 2008. We selected this hotel because it is centrally located and looked good from the outside. What a huge mistake, relying on first impressions! The staff were incapable of simple tasks such as booking a taxi or re-arranging a bed in a room, despite repeated requests to do so. The only thing they were good at was soliciting tips on a regular basis. The room itself had scuff marks on the wall and was in generally poor condition. But they saved the worst until last. On the morning we checked out they demanded 52 euros a day for breakfast, claiming they had informed us of this ridiculous expense beforehand - when they had not. They certainly did not verbally warn us about this and when challenged claimed it had been written on our "greeting card", which it had not as we read it carefully. While our taxi waited to take us to the airport they demanded over 250 euros for a few morning's worth of buffet breakfast, consisting of coffee and croissants. You can imagine the stress this caused us. In the end we had to hand over 170 euros. This hotel is trading on its location and is an absolute disgrace to a beautiful city. Do not stay here if you want to enjoy your Roman holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimdew
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at the Hotel Raphael during our five day trip to Rome. The location was excellent as we were within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. The room was clean and well maintained, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom had all the amenities. Staff was extremely helpful and went the extra distance to answer questions or concerns. Dining at the roof top terrace was a most delightful experience between the food and the service. To go up to the roof after a day of walking around through crowds felt like entering an oasis. The view at sunset was amazing. The hotel was expensive, but worth it I feel for what would most likely be our first and only trip to Rome. If you don't want to pay that much for first class service, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - will go again!”
Reviews.Author: carlosio
Reviews.Content: I recently went to stay here with my husband-to-be, parents and inlaws as I was getting married nearby. The hotel was in a great location, within easy walking distance of the main sights and with lots of gorgeous bars and restaurants in the vicinity. I loved the boutique feel of the hotel, from the Picasso pottery in reception to the designer toiletries in the room. It had an individual feel about it, and the staff were so helpful. Our bed was incredibly comfy, and there was surprisingly little noise to be heard from outside (amazing for Rome!). Breakfast was fantastic - I loved the pancakes and maple syrup! We didn't tell the hotel we were getting married, but they found out (I guess wearing a wedding dress in reception was a give away), and when we got back from the ceremony we found a bottle of champagne on ice with two glasses in our room - such a sweet touch. We had drinks that night on the roof terrace, and it was the perfect setting, with a beautiful view across Rome as the sun set. I would definitely stay here again, without a doubt. It's pricey, but really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: LondonLocations
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just stayed at the Hotel Raphael for three nights. This is a lovely little hotel. The staff were really charming and helpful, the situation is perfect - 1 min walk to the Piazza Navona, 10 mins to a bus stop for a sightseeing tour and probably a 20 min walk to the Vatican. In fact you can pretty much walk to any of the major tourist sights. The room was very small but you don't go to Rome to sit in your room do you?! There was a bit of street noise which meant we had to keep our window closed but we were on the first floor so maybe if you were higher up it wouldn't be so bad. The roof terrace is fantastic - having a glass of wine and watching the sun set over St. Peters was unforgettable. Only one real niggle was the cost of breakfast: 26 Euros each!!! Skip it and go around the corner (literally) to one of the many local cafes and have a expresso and a croissant and watch the world go by! GENERAL TRAVEL TIP FOR FIRST-TIME VISITORS TO ROME: This tip will save you time and money on a trip to the Coliseum - honestly, you will thank me! When you visit the Coliseum you buy a 10 Euro ticket that gives you entrance to the Palatine as well. Visiting the Forum is free. There is a simply enormous queue to buy tickets at the Coliseum so the only way to get in reasonably quickly is accept the hassle from a tour guide and join a group. This costs an extra 8 euros each but you then go through the ticket holders queue which is considerably shorter than the main one. You can then leave the tour guide and do what you want. BUT THERE IS A BETTER WAY! Approach the Coliseum from the direction of Central Rome walking down the Via Fori Imeperiali with the Forum on your right. About halfway down on the right is small turning opposite the Largo Corrada Ricci. Walk down this and you will come to an entrance gate to the Forum where there is a ticket booth from which you can buy tickets to the Coliseum and Palatine! When we went there was a queue of just two people! Buy your tickets here then carry on to the Coliseum, join the pre-paid queue and walk smugly in past everyone else! Cunning eh?

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: Colmeken
Reviews.Content: This is a lovel hotel in an amazing location. We held our wedding reception on the roof top terrace and I couldn't of asked for a more perfect day. The staff and chef were all extremely professional and went the extra mile to make it so special for us. We look forward to returning for our future wedding anniversaries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: top-trippers
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and cannot understand some of the negative feedback. The location just off the Piazza Navona is within easy walking distance of all the major sites. The hotel has lots of character. Do upgrade if possible as the standard rooms can be on the small side although they are still adequate. Lovely views of St Peters from the rooftop terrace. Choice for breakfast was fairly limited but the quality and service was good. For us this was preferable to waiting for the local cafes to open as we like an early start to avoid crowds at the main sites. We also ate at the hotel’s rooftop restaurant and thought the service and food were excellent. Our only complaint was that the hotel failed to inform us that on that particular night the best tables (with views of St Peters) were reserved for a private party. The Concierge made some good recommendations for some smaller local restaurants serving traditional cuisine. Our favourite was L’Angoletto. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, terrible hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hellydad
Reviews.Content: First of all, Rome is always a place not to miss! But me and my husband get a terribel a hotel, this time in Rome. Raphael Hotel is in a true central location but...this is the only good number of the hotel. We have received a "discounted" rate of € 630,00 for a very poor room, without any oplus or a welcome apple in! No warm welcome at reception and when we asked to meet the gen. manager or the reception manager to ask for an upgrade...people looked each other but noone meet us. They said this gentleman (the manager) was always too busy...unbelievable!!! In Italy, this hotel seems to be very popular but for no reason, at all. By the way breakfast was very good....but for a 2 star hotel not for a 4 one! No choice on buffet and very poor kind of items. We asked for fresh orange squeeze and was not inlcuded...with a room rate of € 630,00..... Last year, we was in Rome at Excelsior and will be back there, absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Raphael: Charming hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: clontarf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raphael for three days last weekend in the third floor Richard Maier rooms. Whilst this is not a cheap hotel by any means, it offers value for money for a brilliantly located hotel with a friendly, personal service. Domenico, the concierge, stands out. He was welcoming, helpful and efficient and gave a great face to the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: livngston_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location right off the Piazza Novona. The hotel is very nicely decorated and the rooms are comfortable. Unforuntately, the staff made a mistake and put us in a smoking room. It was so horrible I couldn't sleep the whole night and my wife woke with her chest hurting. They moved us to another room the next day, but claimed they couldn't move us the first day as they were fully booked and already commited the other non-smoking rooms. They further refused to do anything about it. While the hotel was very centrally located, I was annoyed by the service and lack of accomodations there. I felt like because we were Americans they treated us like second class guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: pamelas111
Reviews.Content: Great location near Piazza Navona and short walking distance to all major sites. Very clean room but can be a bit noisy if you leave the windows open. Small room - good bathroom....as another said - skip the breakfast and go to a small bar near the area........we had a very nice stay in Rome and would return here...

Reviews.Title: “Safety”
Reviews.Author: empresstvl
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for the Piazza Navona. Very clean. Rooms extemely small. Okay for single businessman. Bathroom the tiniest we have ever seen. No matter how you turn you bang into something. No room for arms or legs.however great showerhead. We were robbed of our passports in the LOBBY while we were checking in. It was a Saturday, we had to report to the police immediately, where they gave us a stamped report to take to the American Embassy Monday morning. We were flying home Monday, no luck there. Had to change our arrival airport from Newardk to JFK on Tuesday, etc. THe whole fiasco cost us $1400.00 more for our vacation. Make your own judgement. Management and owner most helpful. Owner sent us appetizers and an excellent bottle of Proscecco on our last evening and expressed his regrets, however he should have given us our extra night free, since it happened in his LOBBY.We had lunch on the roof of the Raphael on that extra last day. They could at least have taken that off our bill... Gee Whiz!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New Years stay”
Reviews.Author: jsorensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Raphael over New Years and had a wonderful time. Great location walking distance to everything, was lucky to get an upgrade to an executive room and staff was generally very friendly and helpful. Skipped the expensive breakfast but found plenty of lovely cafe options in the neighborhood. Excellent New Years dinner at the Hosteria del Anima right in front of the hotel and found the most fantastic and friendly little bar 50m down the road from the hotel called Rafatia - if you stay at the Raphael, definitely worth a visit or three. Easy to get to the hotel from the airport via the train to Termini station and then a taxi, don't waste your money on the hotel's expensive shuttle. Overall had a great stay and would certainly recommend the Raphael!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet place in the best part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CaTraveler7777
Reviews.Content: This place is a small hotel covered with ivy right behind the Piazza Navonna, my favorite part of Rome. The rooms are great, particularly the suite (quiet, clean and luxurious). The roof restaurant is a nice way to start the day and you are literally a few steps from the piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: rtrnmac
Reviews.Content: It was so beautiful.....the lobby, the restaurant and the room itself. The staff was great and attentive. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the mediocre 26 euro breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover0000
Reviews.Content: We thought breakfast was included in our somewhat pricey 300 euro rate (hard to imagine it wasn't!). The fact that they charged 26 euros per person for a breakfast that included neither custom omlettes or even champagne turned our positive experience into a negative one. We didn't realize the price until we were checking out (not posted anywhere -- shame on us for not asking!). Up to this realization, we had a positive experience. The hotel was in a fabulous location, our room was nicely furnished /decorated and had high quality linens. The staff was sufficiently helpful. All in all, a good (albeit expensive) place to stay. Just don't have breakfast here.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, good (not great) hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Excellent! There may be no better location than this hotel (and other hotels in the immediate area). Everything is within short walking distance. There are tons of restaurants and charming squares nearby for food. The hotel is on a quiet street. BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Bed is soft and comfortable. Unfortunately it sagged slightly to the middle. Sheets and pillows were great but I’ve seen better. LIGHTING: Lighting was fine in both bedroom and bathroom. BATHROOM/SHOWER: Bathroom was clean but had a badly chipped bathtub. Shower had very hot water if desired and good water pressure. Towels were excellent. TOILETRIES: Bulgari; the kind you want to take home. CLEANLINESS: The entire hotel and room were very clean. A/C: In room but didn’t use. CLOSET SPACE: We had one of the smallest (and least expensive) rooms in the hotel. Not really enough space for 2 to unpack all items. STYLE OF ROOM: Tired. Some rooms on the hotel brochure look amazing, not ours. Although clean, it felt very old and needed updating. I am 34 and this hotel is definitely not my style and is more appropriate for those twice my age. QUIET/LIGHT: Some noise (but not much) could be heard from outside of the room (probably very common if in a good location). The room could be made pitch black during the morning sun. FOOD: Didn’t eat here. Chose not to spend 25 Euros per person on breakfast. TV/INTERNET: Free wired internet in room which was fast. There are 2 computers for guests in the lobby for a charge. There is wireless in the lobby with your own computer for a charge. TV had one of the smallest channel selections we have seen in Europe but the most English stations. Much better than most other hotels with 400 stations and maybe 2 in English. SERVICE: Staff was very pleasant but didn’t go out of their way for one denied request. COMMON AREA: Nice, not gorgeous. Nothing that would make me want to return. Then again, it’s not the right style for those in their 30s and younger. TIPS: There are a few rooms in the hotel that are much smaller than the others that may be had for a lower price. I believe the main value of this hotel is the location but that there are better hotels in the area to be found. I am a little surprised by all the glowing reviews at this hotel. These people must be fairly inexperienced travelers and just don't know better. If you stay here just don't expect the best and if you do stay here I suggest booking an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - close to excellent restaurants and all the sights”
Reviews.Author: Nicky_78
Reviews.Content: We wanted a well placed hotel within walking distance of all the major attractions in Rome. The Hotel Raphael is in a great location so it is pricey but you are right in the heart of the city and we walked pretty much everywhere so must have saved on taxis etc. It's right by the Piazza Navona and there are loads of different places to eat and drink. It's best to try places along the streets leading to the square as they are cheaper and still excellent. The hotel itself has a beautiful terrace with stunning views but it is expensive. We really liked the hotel and found the staff to be helpful and friendly. We arrived to find we'd been upgraded to a suite for no extra cost which was a lovely surprise. The suite had two bathrooms, air con, a large plazma screen and seating area along with nice little touches like fresh sparking water daily and mini cakes each afternoon. If you want to be well placed in Rome then this is a great hotel. It isn't cheap but we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect and always helpfull”
Reviews.Author: JLPLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome having held our wedding reception at the Hotel Raphael on it's fabulous roof terrace. From the minute we contacted the hotel to the day we checked out they could not have been more helpful or produced a reception any better. All our friends had a fantastic time and commented on not just the amazing location - watching the sunset behind the Vatican was truly special - but also on the quality of the food & wine - excellent - and the superb staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. Our room was huge & very comfortable, had 2 bathrooms!! and a bottle of champagne waiting - this may only happen to couples getting married but it shows their attention to detail. All this just a stones throw - literally - from Piazza Navona, it really is a perfect place to stay as the surrounding streets are packed with interesting places to shop/eat and drink. So thank you once again to all at Raphael (especially Raffaella, Laetitia, Steven, Clive & Nicola) I'm sure we'll be back in the coming years on 1st September more than once!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel experiences Ever!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Raphael with my two daughters on the nights of August 10-11 at the end of a two week vacation in Italy. I had read some mixed reviews on this website, so I was unsure what to expect. This hotel is absolutely wonderful. The staff are friendly and helpful and our room was just magnificent. We had the Bramante Suite on the 5th floor, which is really a junior suite with an amazing terrace. The room was well appointed with a king bed, pull out couch, desk and table. There was also an extremely large plasma TV and lovely bathroom furnished with Bulgari toiletries. When we arrived there was a complimentary fruit basket with pastries and a bottle of Antinori Tuscan Red Wine. I promptly poured myself a glass and sat out on the terrace, which overlooked the lovely cloister next door. This hotel spoiled me and it will definitely be my choice for future stays in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent!!”
Reviews.Author: Addmaster
Reviews.Content: After our HORRIBLE staying at the Hotel Genio they sent us at another hotel near the spanish steps named Hotel Sistina. The minute we walked in our bathroom at that hotel everything was crawling with ants. So we made our way to Piazza Navona and checked in at the Hotel Raphael. At first we thought this was terribly expensive and we hoped to find less expensive room through the net. I called my brother home in iceland and he found out that we could have got a room for 250 € instead of the 280 € we were paying. So we talked to the manager next day to be sure they weren't ripping us off. So it all came clear that actually we were in a room which costs 340€ but they gave us a massive discount for some reason unknown. I was over satisfied with the service we got and our room was wonderful. The roof terrace/restaurant was perfect. you could see Sant Angelo Castle, Saint Peters Church, Piazza Venecia and the Justice Palace in its most beautiful sight. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept on and overall this hotel is a DE LUXE. The Valley was very friendly as well :P Thank you for a wonderful stay and arriverdeci Raphael!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location But Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Barbeque
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Raphael for its location and were not disappointed on that score -- the hotel is in a picture perfect quiet street just off of Piazza Navona -- an absolutely ideal spot for a few days of sightseeing in Rome (nearly every major site was in walking distance and Piazza Navona is wonderful at night, with cafes, street performers and excellent pizza and gelato). The hotel is in the process of being renovated and there is a very big difference in standard between the old fashioned rooms and the modern rooms and suites. The roof terrace is great, although only open for expensive drinks and dinner. Breakfast (try to book a rate specifically including breakfast and get this in writing) was bountiful and served in an art filled modern breakfast room. The major drawback of this hotel is the service. The front desk was friendly enough but lacked basic knowledge about sightseeing in Rome and seemed hopelessly muddled when it came to simple tasks like reserving airport transport -- and completely unhelpful for any real travel assistance such as booking tickets. We might return to the hotel for its divine location and pleasant modern rooms (though beware the unrenovated clunkers) but with no expectation that we would get any useful assistance during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Eur0peanTraveller
Reviews.Content: They don't seem to like guests who book through an agency (we booked through GTAhotels.com) put us on the top floor, only room occupied on floor next to rooms where there was work going on, even though the hotel was not busy at all. Tiles were being scraped from walls and floor next door, noisy. Bathroom was GHASTLY with something like mould or dirt all around the bathtub edge, one would be afraid to sit in it. Smell of smoke in furnishings (non-smoking room had been requested), Furnishings old, had a dusty feel. Nice tapestry above bed though. Size of room and bathroom good. Breakfast was excellent., restaurant new modern decor, very pleasant. After two nights we stayed in a hotel with cleaner facilities for half the price around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “It was worth it for location alone”
Reviews.Author: delpreted
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Sure, the rooms are VERY small (I would suggest the deluxe room if you can spend the extra euro). The staff is wonderful, and it is a stone throw away from Piazza Navona. You are right in the historical center of Rome....magnificient. Alos, forget spending the extra 22 euros for breakfast. You can just walk a few steps and go to oneof the bar on Piazza Navona and get a great cappuccino and cornetto. I would definitely return, but only to stay in their deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: chriswaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Raphael for 7 nights in Nov 2006. Our stay was excellent and the location would be very hard to beat in all of Rome. We were able to walk to every single tourist attraction in the city (we aren't marathon runners, but we are in decent shape). There are more restaurants than you could imagine within a 5 minute walk, including some of the touristy places in Piazza Navona and more locally visited places in the nearby meandering streets. We were able to walk from the Hotel to Vatican City in 10-15 minutes, to the Spanish steps in 10-15, to the Roman Forum in 20 and the Colisseum in 25 minutes. The interior of the hotel was clean and cozy. The rooms were average size for Europe and the bathroom was larger than many in Europe. The staff was very friendly, in particular the doormen/porters made us feel at home everytime we left or returned to the hotel. Rome was very friendly, felt very safe and was a great place for travelers that want to both see and live history. The only warning I'd give is that Rome is not for families with young kids or anyone that has trouble walking. Anyone planning a trip to Rome should seriously consider the Hotel Raphael. I would highly recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific roof-top restaurant”
Reviews.Author: swissms.
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in a seemingly quiet street near the Piazza Navona (the heart of Rome.) It is a comfortable stroll to Vatican City too. The lobby boasts Miro paintings and a chic ambiance. The restaurant on the roof top terrace affords a tranquil and pretty view of Roma. There was a yummy dish of pasta that is shaped square (instead of round) spaghetti that I'd never seen before.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights in The Hotel Raphael in September - it was our second stay. We stayed here in 2002 and liked it very much. On our floor (two) and the first floor absolutely no work had been done in the intervening years. The room we were allocated at first, 111, should be avoided at all costs. It was small ugly dark looked onto a wall and had airconditioning that was unbelievably noisy. My husband said the bathroom looked like something from a 1950s sanitorium. He went to reception and after insisting on a change we were taken to a room on the second floor. Although the decor was very dated and the room was on the small side it looked out to the Largo Febo & was light filled & the air conditioning & bathroom were ok. When we showered even with the bath plug totally removed the water came up to our ankles & took time to empty. Over the next five days we had a nice stay. The staff were very helpful. The cleaning pretty good. The roof terrace a delight. However, many guests could be heard complaining - plumbing didn't work - rooms were small. We even saw a woman crying in the hall with a staff member saying how terrible her room was how she'd been promised a change & it hadn't happened & her wedding anniversary trip was ruined. You could see staff were trying very hard to cope with people's disappointment. It's clear that the hotel needs significant investment to bring it up to the standard it advertises.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive option”
Reviews.Author: suzigun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just behind Piazza Navona. Having admired the outside of the hotel on previous visits I was keen to stay here. The service was OK, but the cost of breakfast (EUR 26 each) and the drinks etc compared to local bars meant that we didn't make much use of the hotel, other than as a place to sleep. I'm always on the lookout for a hotel with a roof terrace, but this one didn't encourage you to go up there unless you wanted to pay for drinks - an expensive way to get a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: 99 Jones
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hotel Raphael in late May and stayed for three nights. It's in an excellent location near the Piazza Novona. We had a good room with a non-descript view, but the view from the roof terrace bar more than made up for it. The hotel and its services are expensive but I suppose it keeps the standards high. There some nice (and not so nice) restaurants within a short walking distance. We would recommend one for lunch that you can see below you from the hotel roof terrace; it is attached to the art gallery behind the hotel. It took us days to find it so I'll leave you with the same puzzle.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, bathrooms flooded and smelled ”
Reviews.Author: Someone_in_NY
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel...! We can definitely say this because we booked four (4) rooms at the hotel Raphael. We just recently returned from Rome and spent four nights with our family of 8 in this hotel. This is the second time we've booked this hotel and the staff service, room accomodations and maintenance have deteriorated tremendously since the first time we where here three years ago. Needless to say, we had problems in all four rooms from the start. All of our rooms were tiny. One of the rooms had the smell of a permanent sewer and the A/C did not work at all. We tried to get the hotel staff to change this room and they were least bothered with it. Then we tried to get them to fix the A/C and remove the sewer smell coming from the bathroom, and after three days, it was never fixed. This was specially unbearable if you are in Rome in the middle of July. One of the rooms had a bathroom that flooded every time you took a shower and the other two rooms had bathrooms so small that your chin hit the sink each time you sat in the toilet. Another annoyance is the lack of mirrors in the bedroom. It was difficult to put on makeup if there are two people standing in the bathroom. The hotel hallways were not air-conditioned either. Every time we walked out of our rooms, it felt like we were hitting a sauna. Another big minus is that their drinks (OJs and cokes) in their rooftop terrace are very expensive. We had no alcohol and the bill for 8 came to over $100 euros! Breakfast was also outrageously priced at $52 euros per room considering the poor selection in food. The only plus to this hotel is its location next to Piazza Navona and the comfortable pillows. However, we could not overlook the bad service and lousy rooms for the high price we paid.... we certainly would NOT got back or recommend this hotel to anyone...!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know what to expect...”
Reviews.Author: blndzhvmrfn
Reviews.Content: After reading the recent reviews posted on this site, we really did not know what to expect from the Hotel Raphael- other than a great location. So you can imagine our relief to find not just the perfect location but a great hotel and staff when we arrived last week. We reserved a suite and received a perfectly wonderful room complete with the best hotel closet I have ever seen! We had stayed in the neighborhood before and thought we knew the area but the concierge made several nice recommendations for dinner that we would have never found otherwise. The staff was not anoyingly attentive but very responsive and that is the way we like them to be - not too obtrusive. The only negative was the 50 euro breakfast which we chose not to include with the room. That was easily remedied with tea and pastries at a local cafe. One suggestion - eat dinner at the completely romantic roof top restaurant! We can recommend this hotel with ease to anyone who likes a discreet albeit expensive hideaway in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bobbiehpvb
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Raphael is tucked away on a side street near Piazza Navona. It was a great location from which to see the sights of Rome. My husband and I stayed there for 8 nights in May. We had never been to Rome and chose the hotel mainly for its location. We were able to walk everywhere, from the Vatican to the ancient sites of the Forum and Colosseum, Piazza Popolo, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Campo di Fiori and Trastevere. We were able to get back every afternoon in time for an afternoon refreshment at Tre Scalini on Piazza Navona -- great for people watching. Good local restaurants within walking distance that were not terribly expensive were La Fiametta, Il Buco, and Teatro di Pompeo. The Hotel Raphael was very expensive as hotel rooms seem to be in Rome, but we were able to get somewhat of a deal through Expedia. Our room was fairly spacious, which I have heard is unusual in Rome. We had a separate sitting area from the alcove where the bed was. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was good-sized, with a tub and a rainfall-type shower, which worked great. Our room was at the end of a hallway on the 2nd floor (their third above the street) and was very quiet the entire time we were there. The room was spotlessly cleaned every day and there was turndown service most nights. They have a restaurant that serves breakfast, but we didn't eat there because it was very expensive (over 20 euros per person), choosing instead to walk to Cafe Eustacchio near the Pantheon for coffee and cornetti, which is reputed to have the best coffee in Rome. We would agree. There was only one major glitch in our stay. We had prearranged transportation through the hotel's concierge from the airport to the hotel for our arrival, which I had re-confirmed via-email before arrival. There was no one waiting for us at the airport, so I had to buy a phone card and call the hotel. The young man who answered the phone, Fabio, showed no record of our transportation arrangements, but he quickly arranged for someone to pick us up. Unfortunately, the man who picked us up spoke no English and did not know where the hotel was. We tried to help with our maps and rudimentary Italian, and he stopped and asked for directions three times. We finally made it. Fabio at the front desk was our "go-to" guy the whole time were there. He spoke excellent English and was very helpful whenever we had questions or requests. They have internet service in the lobby that was out of commission for three days of our stay, but Fabio graciously offered use of the hotel's computer if we really needed it. All in all, I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay. For tourists wanting to see as much of Rome as possible on foot, it's location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last stay on our honeymoon, Hotel Raphael was beautiful from the outside. We were greated by a friendly door man. At the front desk we were told that our room didn't incude breakfast even though our itinerary said otherwise. They wouldn't budge and told us we were out of luck. We decided to go out and walk around when we got back we settled in and tried to close the automatic shade. To our surprise it didn't work, we called down to the front desk and he explained how it worked. When it didn't work he got annoyed and said he would be right up. When he came up and realized it was broke he said that no one could fix it. Bottom line it never got fixed. We were told by Domonic (who was very arrogant) that it would be fixed the following day and that there was nothing he could do for us b/c once the hotel found out that it was our honeymoon the upgraded us to a classic room. Which was surpising considering this room was a cell. The next day we found the workers in our room but no fixed window. We were forced to tie a sheet to the window on our honeymoon. Although there lack of graciousness to us this hotel is in an excellent location. It was minutes from Piazza Di Novona, and the Pantheon. We did enjoy our stay in Rome we just hoped that we would of been treated better. Also we recommed the grocery store by the Pantheon, you can get drinks and beer much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Greal Location, but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: smrnj
Reviews.Content: I recenly came back from a 3 night stay at the Raphael. The hotel is on a small, cobblestone street that just typifies Rome. Its very exciting to arrive at the Raphael. The staff is okay, but not great. English at the hotel is not as good as in the other hotels i staye at in Italy, and the front desk was not willing to retrieve ferry schedule/information for an excursion to Capri. Additionally, the hotel failed to notify us that they are in the midst of construction. Unfortunately, our room was 2 rooms over from the construction and the first 2 days, we got almost no sleep. The rooms, without construction are loud, with ample street noise, noise from the front desk and noise from the restaurant. If you plan on staying here, I recommend not staying on the first floor (definitely not rooms 116 or 118). The front desk was not sympathetic to the noise problem, which was extremely disappointing. The hotel is located at Piazza Novana which is a great area to stay, away from the commercial aspects of the Spanish Steps, but close enough to all the main attractions, though there is no Metro stop nearby. All in all, i enjoyed parts of the Rahpael, but would not return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesLovehols
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel within walking distance of all the major attractions, just off Piazza Navona and near to Pantheon (5 minutes) & Trevi Fountain (7-10 minutes). There are plenty of places to eat in Piazza Navona, Campo De'Fiori and at the Pantheon. The city tour buses also stop nearby. The rooms are quite small however (but you won't be in it very much!. The bathroom is lovely with marbled floor and white robes. Shame there are no coffee or tea making facilities in the room or bottled water. Another disadvantage is the breakfast is very expensive (26 euros). This is a real shame as it has such a lovely rooftop terrace restaurant with fantastic views of Rome! My husband and I tended to go to one of the Cafes nearby and grab a pastry or croissant and a coffee for breakfast. There is also a lovely bakers nearby where you can buy fresh pastries and bread. We would definitely go back to this hotel and we recommend it to others as the location is excellent and staff are friendly and helpful.
